creator: jesse.glick@netbeans.com
text:
In Ant 1.5.3, if I e.g. have the XHTML 1.1 distribution and try:

<mkdir dir="dtds"/>
<unzip dest="dtds" src="xhtml1.zip">
    <patternset>
        <include name="xhtml1-20020801/DTD/"/>
    </patternset>
</unzip>

it does not work - the directory dtds/xhtml1-20020801/DTD/ is created but left
empty. If however I change the <include> to read:

        <include name="xhtml1-20020801/DTD/**"/>

then it works - all files in that part of the ZIP file (e.g. xhtml1-strict.dtd)
are extracted to the disk directory.

Generally appending "**" to a <include> name ending in "/" is supposed to be a
no-op, so this is inconsistent with usage in e.g. <fileset>. Intentional or bug?
I don't think that foo/ is equivalent to foo/** anywhere, is it?
creator: bodewig@apache.org

text:
docs/manual/dirtasks.html says under "Patterns":

"There is one "shorthand" - if a pattern ends with / or \, then ** is appended.
For example, mypackage/test/ is interpreted as if it were mypackage/test/**."

and in fact this works fine for filesets in other tasks that I am aware of.
creator: jesse.glick@netbeans.com

text:
So I should read our own documentation more thoroughly, thanks 8-)

The code that handles patternsets in Expand is quite different from the one used
inside tasks to expand filesets - and it obviously doesn't know about the shortcut
from our docs.
